text: Paulo José Gómez de Souza (20 March 1937 - 11 August 2021) was a Brazilian actor and filmmaker. He was born in Lavras do Sul, Rio Grande do Sul. His career began in 1965 and he retired in 2018. He was known for playing the priest in The Priest and the Girl (1966), white Macunaíma in Macunaíma (1969) and Vladimir in The Clown (2011). In 1992, José was diagnosed with Parkinson's disease.
